oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dottie West interview - Biff Collie - 1965
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Dottie West (performer), conducted by Biff Collie in 1965.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie asks Dottie West if she is an overnight sensation -- Dottie West denies that claim -- Collie talks about her being one of the fastest growing female artists around -- Dottie Talks about her hometown -- Dottie talks about her first music job being on a radio show in Ohio -- Dottie talks about recording since 1959 -- Dottie talks about being glad she crawled before she walked in the music business so she could learn the right and the wrong way to do things -- Dottie talks about working with Connie Smith -- Dottie talks about being mainly a sad, ballad singer -- Collie says the he think West will be Ms. Country Music in 1965 -- West thanks him -- Collie talks about Dottie being a pioneer for female country artists -- Collie concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: West, Dottie, 1932-1991; Collie, Biff;
